item.title: The Little Mountain Democracy That Sustains Tibet’s Refugee Nation
item.description: The exile government that was built by the Dalai Lama to preserve Tibetans’ cultural identity will be put to the test by his eventual succession.

item.title: Albert Ojwang Was Killed in Police Custody. Kenyans Are Not About to Let It Go.
item.description: At the funeral for Albert Ojwang, protesters in Kenya said his death was a call to action for the country’s youth.

item.title: Can Australia Pull Off Barring Children From Social Media?
item.description: A law that restricts social media use to people 16 and over goes into effect in December, but much about it remains unclear or undecided.

item.title: Why the Dalai Lama’s Succession Is Complicated
item.description: Just before the Dalai Lama turned 90, he announced that his successor would be selected through the traditional process of reincarnation. Mujib Mashal...

item.title: Khamenei Appears in Public for First Time Since Israel War Began
item.description: The long absence of Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, from public life had fueled speculation about his health and threats to his life.
